div.bibl: The Reform Advocate, Vol. 50, Wk. of Jan. 22, 1916. p. 750.

body.p: A group of young women have banded together and are bringing into existence the Big Sister Movement of Chicago. Its aim is to take care of the younger girls in the congested parts of the city, taking a personal interest in them, and bringing out any talent they may possess.
The officers are president, Mrs. Louis Greenberg, secretary, Miss Anna Preaskill and treasurer, Jean Feldman.
